current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To promote consumer choice and wireless competition by
		  permitting consumers to unlock mobile wireless devices, and for other
		  purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

action-instruction.#text: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

short-title.#text:
Unlocking Consumer Choice and
			 Wireless Competition Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

header.#text:
Repeal of
			 existing rule and additional rulemaking by Librarian of Congress

external-xref.#tail:
of title 37, Code of
			 Federal Regulations, as amended and revised by the Librarian of Congress
			 on
			 October 28, 2012, pursuant to his authority under section 1201(a) of title
			 17,
			 United States Code, shall have no force and effect, and such paragraph
			 shall
			 read, and shall be in effect, as such paragraph was in effect on July 27,
			 2010.

text.#text:
Not
			 later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Librarian
			 of
			 Congress, upon the recommendation of the Register of Copyrights, who shall
			 consult with the Assistant Secretary for Communications and Information of
			 the
			 Department of Commerce and report and comment on his or her views in
			 making
			 such recommendation, shall determine, consistent with the requirements set
			 forth under

external-xref.#tail:
of title 17, United States Code, whether to
			 extend the exemption for the class of works described in section
			 201.40(b)(3)
			 of title 37, Code of Federal Regulations, as amended by subsection (a), to
			 include any other category of wireless devices in addition to wireless
			 telephone handsets.

text.#text:
Nothing in this Act alters, or shall be construed to
			 alter, the authority of the Librarian of Congress under section 1201(a)(1)
			 of
			 title 17, United States Code.

continuation-text.#text:
may be initiated by the owner of any such handset or other device, by another person at the
			 direction of the owner, or by a provider of a commercial mobile radio
			 service or a commercial mobile data service at the direction of such owner
			 or other person, solely in order to enable such owner or a family member
			 of such owner to connect to a wireless telecommunications network, when
			 such connection is authorized by the operator of such network.

text.#text:
Circumvention of a technological measure that restricts wireless telephone handsets or other
			 wireless devices from connecting to a wireless telecommunications network—

mean a handset or other device that operates on a wireless telecommunications network.
